text:
Last summer, I worked in the Pneumology Department. Actually, the main objective was to improve my experience, and discover some pathologies (related on what I learned last year). In fact, there is no doubt that the more we practice, the more we learn. I worked with nurses, physiotherapists and doctors. I was there for 3 weeks, which was pretty enough to see and learn plenty of abilities.
There were other students with me and everybody was very welcoming, and explain me each time I didn't know to do something.
I work in a hospital near from my parents' house, so not in Rennes CHU. It is interessant to compare organisation in a hospital different where we are going to do almost all stages.
 I enjoyed this experience. I met nice and passionated people and I progressed a lot. As far as I am concerned, I have the feeling that the best way to learn is to practise, because sometimes what we learn in theory is too far from reality... Obviously, we need to associate theory with practice because they are complementary.
Moreoever, as a doctor we need to develop relational abilities, so that I could improve them. It is very grateful to feel helpful and improve patients' quality of life, discuss with them about their worrying and rassured them.
To sum up, this experience was very interesting and helpful for my studies.
